description: Describes the default AWS KMS key for EBS encryption by default for your account in this Region.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Retrieving the default KMS key provides information about the encryption settings of the EBS volumes in the account.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.technique: T1530 - Data from Cloud Storage Object
unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: By knowing the KMS key, attackers could potentially access encrypted data if they manage to retrieve the corresponding encrypted volumes.
Attackers could use this information to modify or disable encryption settings, impacting defenses.
Attackers might use the default KMS key information to create resources that appear legitimate but are malicious in nature.
The KMS key might be part of broader efforts to discover unsecured private keys in the environment

incidents.description: Compromised Cloud Compute Credentials: Case Studies From the Wild

securityImplications: Attackers might use GetEbsDefaultKmsKeyId to identify the default AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key used for encrypting new Amazon EBS volumes.
